title: How to Make Banana Loaf

steps.headline: Butter a loaf tin.
steps.description: Use a conventional 20 x 13cm tin or a muffin tin.

steps.headline: Beat the sugar and butter.
steps.description: Place them in a large mixing bowl and beat until the mixture is light and fluffy.

steps.headline: Add the eggs, bananas and buttermilk.
steps.description: Continue beating until the mixture is completely combined.

steps.headline: Mix the dry ingredients in a separate bowl.
steps.description: Stir together the flour, bicarbonate of soda, cinnamon and ginger until fully combined.

steps.headline: Stir the dry mixture into the batter.
steps.description: Use a wooden spoon to fold the dry ingredients in until they're just incorporated. Be careful not to overmix, since this will cause the loaf to come out too dense. If desired, stir in 50g chopped pecans, walnuts, almonds or chocolate chips (or a combination of all of your favorites). Mix until just combined.

steps.headline: Spoon the batter into the loaf tin.
steps.description: Use the back of the spoon to level the top.

steps.headline: Bake the loaf for 1 hour and 15 minutes.
steps.description: The loaf is ready when a toothpick poked into the center comes out clean.

steps.headline: Remove it from the oven and allow it to cool before slicing.
steps.description: Serve the loaf with butter or whipped cream.

steps.headline: Butter a loaf tin.
steps.description: Use a conventional 20 x 13cm tin or a muffin tin.

steps.headline: Soften the dates.
steps.description: Boil 200ml of water in a small pot. Add the dates and let them boil for 5 minutes. Drain the dates and save the sweet liquid in a cup.

steps.headline: Blend the dates with the bananas.
steps.description: Add them to a food processor or blender with 100ml of the date liquid. Blend until completely smooth.

steps.headline: Mix up the batter.
steps.description: Place the nuts, dried fruit, flour, spices and baking powder in a mixing bowl and stir until combined. Add the date and banana puree as well as the rum. Stir until the mixture has the consistency of batter.

steps.headline: Fold in the eggs.
steps.description: Beat them into the batter one at a time until just combined with the loaf batter.

steps.headline: Spoon the batter into the tin.
steps.description: Use the back of the spoon to smooth the top of the batter.

steps.headline: Bake the loaf for 1 hour.
steps.description: The loaf is ready when a toothpick poked into the center comes out clean, and the top is golden brown.

steps.headline: Cool the loaf before serving.
steps.description: Cut it into slices and serve with tea.

steps.headline: Oil a loaf tin.
steps.description: Use a conventional 20 x 13cm tin or a muffin tin.

steps.headline: Mix the bananas, oil and sugar.
steps.description: Place them in a bowl and mix until smooth and creamy.

steps.headline: Stir together the dry ingredients.
steps.description: Place the flour, baking powder and cinnamon in a separate bowl and stir until well combined.

steps.headline: Add the flour mixture to the banana mixture.
steps.description: Use a spoon to stir the batter until just combined. Stir in the nuts and dried fruit if you choose to use them.

steps.headline: Spoon the batter into the loaf tin.
steps.description: Use the back of the spoon to smooth the top of the batter.

steps.headline: Bake the loaf for 1 hour.
steps.description: The loaf is ready when a toothpick poked into the center comes out clean, and the top is golden brown.

steps.headline: Cool the loaf before serving.
steps.description: Cut it into slices and serve with tea.

text: Classic Banana Loaf Preheat the oven to 160C/fan 180C/gas 4.  Butter a loaf tin. Use a conventional 20 x 13cm tin or a muffin tin. Beat the sugar and butter. Place them in a large mixing bowl and beat until the mixture is light and fluffy. Add the eggs, bananas and buttermilk. Continue beating until the mixture is completely combined. Mix the dry ingredients in a separate bowl. Stir together the flour, bicarbonate of soda, cinnamon and ginger until fully combined. Stir the dry mixture into the batter. Use a wooden spoon to fold the dry ingredients in until they're just incorporated. Be careful not to overmix, since this will cause the loaf to come out too dense. If desired, stir in 50g chopped pecans, walnuts, almonds or chocolate chips (or a combination of all of your favorites). Mix until just combined. Spoon the batter into the loaf tin. Use the back of the spoon to level the top. Bake the loaf for 1 hour and 15 minutes. The loaf is ready when a toothpick poked into the center comes out clean. Remove it from the oven and allow it to cool before slicing. Serve the loaf with butter or whipped cream. Date and Rum Banana Loaf Preheat the oven to fan 180C/fan 160C/gas 4.  Butter a loaf tin. Use a conventional 20 x 13cm tin or a muffin tin. Soften the dates. Boil 200ml of water in a small pot. Add the dates and let them boil for 5 minutes. Drain the dates and save the sweet liquid in a cup. Blend the dates with the bananas. Add them to a food processor or blender with 100ml of the date liquid. Blend until completely smooth. Mix up the batter. Place the nuts, dried fruit, flour, spices and baking powder in a mixing bowl and stir until combined. Add the date and banana puree as well as the rum. Stir until the mixture has the consistency of batter. Fold in the eggs. Beat them into the batter one at a time until just combined with the loaf batter. Spoon the batter into the tin. Use the back of the spoon to smooth the top of the batter. Bake the loaf for 1 hour. The loaf is ready when a toothpick poked into the center comes out clean, and the top is golden brown. Cool the loaf before serving. Cut it into slices and serve with tea. Vegan Banana Loaf Preheat the oven to fan 180C/fan 160C/gas 4.  Oil a loaf tin. Use a conventional 20 x 13cm tin or a muffin tin. Mix the bananas, oil and sugar. Place them in a bowl and mix until smooth and creamy. Stir together the dry ingredients. Place the flour, baking powder and cinnamon in a separate bowl and stir until well combined. Add the flour mixture to the banana mixture. Use a spoon to stir the batter until just combined. Stir in the nuts and dried fruit if you choose to use them. Spoon the batter into the loaf tin. Use the back of the spoon to smooth the top of the batter. Bake the loaf for 1 hour. The loaf is ready when a toothpick poked into the center comes out clean, and the top is golden brown. Cool the loaf before serving. Cut it into slices and serve with tea.
